definition: to instigate/to incite/to egg sb on

sentences.english: He egged her on  to throw a stone through the window.
sentences.chinese: 他慫恿她扔一塊石頭打破窗戶。

sentences.english: The thinking is to incite violence against whom the sum?
sentences.chinese: 二思慫恿暴力是要跟誰鬧彆扭？

sentences.english: She drove him on to commit murder.
It incited the government to impose tax on all of the immigrants.
sentences.chinese: 它慫恿政府向所有移民徵稅，一個也不能豁免。

sentences.english: Jack is always egging me on to drive faster.
sentences.chinese: 傑克老是慫恿我開快車。

sentences.english: Thus, in his instigation , they are willing to do the sexual process.
sentences.chinese: 因此，在男友慫恿下，她們願意一起自拍性愛過程。

sentences.english: A punky band is prodding uproar.
sentences.chinese: 一個朋克樂隊是慫恿一片譁然。

sentences.english: The orchestra eggs the soloist on with its regular quavers.
sentences.chinese: 交響樂團用有規律的八分音符慫恿着獨奏者。

sentences.english: Egged on by his wife, Macbeth planned to murder his king.
sentences.chinese: 在妻子的慫恿下，馬克白計劃謀殺他的國王。

sentences.english: In response, some other users of the site egged him on.
sentences.chinese: 在回覆中，有一些網民慫恿他付諸行動。

sentences.english: Japanese official says there is no evidence the Chinese government has been encouraging fishermen to behave provocatively.
sentences.chinese: 日本官員說並無證據表明中國政府慫恿漁民出來挑釁。

sentences.english: The other boys egged him on to fight.
sentences.chinese: 其他孩子慫恿他去打架。

sentences.english: They urged me to take the action.
sentences.chinese: 他們都慫恿我來採取行動。

sentences.english: His friend advised him to take hallucinogens so he could be brave and courageous.
sentences.chinese: 他的朋友們慫恿他服用迷幻劑去鼓起勇氣表白。

sentences.english: He urged me to go with him.
Joey and Chandler are egging him on to go talk to her.
sentences.chinese: 僑依和錢德勒在慫恿他去和她搭話。

definition: to seize an opportunity/to take advantage of situation
to believe (sth in relation to oneself)/to regard oneself as/to acknowledge (sth in relation to oneself)/to resign oneself to
to coerce (sb into doing sth bad)/to lure (into a trap)/to seduce
not to accept as correct (idiom); to object/to disapprove/to take exception to
to advise/to urge/to try to persuade/to exhort/to console/to soothe
to see with one's own eyes/very soon
to answer/to respond/to answer positively/to agree/to accept/to promise
to disturb/to look for trouble/to stir up a row/to bother sb intentionally
all over the place/everywhere and all directions
